node.title: Travelling 600km for a COVID test 'completely unviable', fed-up mum says
node.alt: A dark-haired, dark-eyed woman standing outside, wearing a work shirt.
node.description: Outback residents say it's absurd that COVID testing is not available anywhere near the SA-NT border, particularly amid a scare at the nearby APY Lands.
node.content:
["A pastoralist in South Australia's remote far north says residents are being forced to travel 600 kilometres for COVID-19 testing despite a nearby scare.", "Over the weekend, SA Health found traces of COVID-19 in wastewater from the Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara (APY) Lands community of Indulkana, north-west\u00a0of Gillian Fennell's property.", "The closest possible testing site for Ms Fennell and her family is at Coober Pedy, 300km away.", "There is no testing available at the township of Marla, which acts as the Northern Territory border checkpoint and is only 75km from her home.", "\"I'm just so disappointed that the state government have had two years to work this out and we haven't even warranted a single thought or bit of consideration for the distance and isolation that is involved here.\"", "A negative COVID test is\u00a0required needed to enter the APY Lands and to cross into the NT.", "\"To get to the APY or up to Alice Springs you have to double backwards first,\" Ms Fennell said.", "", "
Ms Fennell's\u00a0station is 75km from the town of Marla.(Supplied: Gillian Fennell)
", "
'Hasn't even been considered'
", "Ms Fennell and her family decided against travelling to a recent school event over the border in Alice Springs \u2014 the round trip to get tested would have taken as long as travelling to the event itself.", "\"We just couldn't do it,\" she said.", "Ms Fennell said it made sense for Marla to have a testing facility.", "\"It's ludicrous that Marla is the closest town to a major state border on a major highway and hasn't even been considered in the testing regime,\" she said.", "", "
Multiple agencies have been in the Indulkana community to test and vaccinate residents and retest wastewater.(Facebook:\u00a0APY Lands)
", "
All clear in APY Lands so far
", "A statement from the APY Lands said representatives from SA Health, SA Pathology, SAPOL, Nganampa Health and the Royal Flying Doctor Service\u00a0had\u00a0been in the Indulkana community to retest\u00a0wastewater\u00a0and\u00a0help people get tested and vaccinated.", "The statement said\u00a0all 239 COVID\u00a0tests carried out at Indulkana had come back negative.", "A directive\u00a0from the APY board has\u00a0limited fuel sales to 20 litres in the area and blocked cash withdrawals from ATMs for the remainder\u00a0of the month.", "An SA Health spokesperson said\u00a0the results of a second\u00a0Indulkana wastewater test came back as a low positive.", "They believe the positive results have most likely come from a person on the lands who had previously contracted COVID-19, but is no longer infectious.\u00a0", "SA Health will now monitor wastewater samples across the APY Lands out of an abundance of caution.\u00a0", "Additionally, a statement from the\u00a0Eyre and Far North Local Health Network said it was \"always exploring ways to make COVID-19 testing as accessible as possible to everyone, including people living in rural and remote communities\".", "\"However, in many cases, some travel is required to access COVID-19 testing in larger communities that have appropriate levels of staffing and to ensure a timely result can be provided.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
